trans-unit.source: R Language Modules
trans-unit.target: R Language Modules

trans-unit.source: Support for the R language in Azure Machine Learning makes it easier than ever to publish R models in production and to use the experience of the R language community to solve real-world problems.
trans-unit.target: Support for the R language in Azure Machine Learning makes it easier than ever to publish R models in production and to use the experience of the R language community to solve real-world problems.

trans-unit.source: Requirements when Using R
trans-unit.target: Requirements when Using R

trans-unit.source: Before using R script in Azure Machine Learning Studio, be sure to understand the following requirements:
trans-unit.target: Before using R script in Azure Machine Learning Studio, be sure to understand the following requirements:

trans-unit.source: If you imported data that uses CSV or other formats, you must convert the data to a dataset before using the data in an R module.
trans-unit.target: If you imported data that uses CSV or other formats, you must convert the data to a dataset before using the data in an R module.

trans-unit.source: When you attach a dataset as input to an R module, the dataset is automatically loaded into the R workspace as a data frame with the variable name, <legacyBold>dataset</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: When you attach a dataset as input to an R module, the dataset is automatically loaded into the R workspace as a data frame with the variable name, <legacyBold>dataset</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: You can define additional data frames or change the name of the workspace variable within your R script.
trans-unit.target: You can define additional data frames or change the name of the workspace variable within your R script.

trans-unit.source: The R modules run in a sandbox within your private workspace.
trans-unit.target: The R modules run in a sandbox within your private workspace.

trans-unit.source: Within your workspace, you can create data frames and variables for use by multiple modules.
trans-unit.target: Within your workspace, you can create data frames and variables for use by multiple modules.

trans-unit.source: However, you cannot load R data frames from a different workspace or read variables created in a different workspace, even if that workspace is open in an Azure session.
trans-unit.target: However, you cannot load R data frames from a different workspace or read variables created in a different workspace, even if that workspace is open in an Azure session.

trans-unit.source: The implementation of R in the Azure Machine Learning Studio and workspace environment includes two principal components: one that coordinates running the script, and one that provides high-speed data access and scoring.
trans-unit.target: The implementation of R in the Azure Machine Learning Studio and workspace environment includes two principal components: one that coordinates running the script, and one that provides high-speed data access and scoring.

trans-unit.source: Scoring has been optimized to enhance scalability and performance.
trans-unit.target: Scoring has been optimized to enhance scalability and performance.

trans-unit.source: The R implementation in Azure Machine Learning Studio supports two types of scoring tasks, each optimized for different requirements: experimentation and scoring on a file-by-file basis, and request response scoring via a web service.
trans-unit.target: The R implementation in Azure Machine Learning Studio supports two types of scoring tasks, each optimized for different requirements: experimentation and scoring on a file-by-file basis, and request response scoring via a web service.

trans-unit.source: Which R Packages Are Supported ?
trans-unit.target: Which R Packages Are Supported ?

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Studio includes over 400 of the most popular R packages.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Studio includes over 400 of the most popular R packages.

trans-unit.source: However, the packages that are supported in the experiment environment can change, so if you have any doubts about whether an R package is supported, use the following code to get the complete list of packages in the current environment:
trans-unit.target: However, the packages that are supported in the experiment environment can change, so if you have any doubts about whether an R package is supported, use the following code to get the complete list of packages in the current environment:

trans-unit.source: The list of installed R packages is printed to the output log.
trans-unit.target: The list of installed R packages is printed to the output log.

trans-unit.source: To view the output log, run the experiment, select the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, and click the <ui>View output log</ui> link near the bottom of the module parameter pane.
trans-unit.target: To view the output log, run the experiment, select the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, and click the <ui>View output log</ui> link near the bottom of the module parameter pane.

trans-unit.source: To help R users understand the packages that are available, the R documentation site also provides a categorized list of packages, which you can search by keywords: <externalLink><linkText>http://www.rdocumentation.org/</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rdocumentation.org/</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: To help R users understand the packages that are available, the R documentation site also provides a categorized list of packages, which you can search by keywords: <externalLink><linkText>http://www.rdocumentation.org/</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rdocumentation.org/</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: Additional R Resources
trans-unit.target: Additional R Resources

trans-unit.source: For additional R code samples and help with R and its applications, see these resources:
trans-unit.target: For additional R code samples and help with R and its applications, see these resources:

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>R Project</linkText><linkUri>http://www.r-project.org/</linkUri></externalLink>: The official site for the R language
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>R Project</linkText><linkUri>http://www.r-project.org/</linkUri></externalLink>: The official site for the R language

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Rseek</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rseek.org/</linkUri></externalLink>: A search engine for R resources
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Rseek</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rseek.org/</linkUri></externalLink>: A search engine for R resources

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>R-bloggers</linkText><linkUri>http://www.r-bloggers.com/</linkUri></externalLink>: An aggregation of blogs in the R community
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>R-bloggers</linkText><linkUri>http://www.r-bloggers.com/</linkUri></externalLink>: An aggregation of blogs in the R community

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>CRAN</linkText><linkUri>http://cran.r-project.org/web/views/</linkUri></externalLink>: The largest repository of R packages
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>CRAN</linkText><linkUri>http://cran.r-project.org/web/views/</linkUri></externalLink>: The largest repository of R packages

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Quick-R</linkText><linkUri>http://www.statmethods.net/</linkUri></externalLink>: A good R tutorial
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Quick-R</linkText><linkUri>http://www.statmethods.net/</linkUri></externalLink>: A good R tutorial

trans-unit.source: Webinar: Learn How to Get Faster End Results from Your R Models
trans-unit.target: Webinar: Learn How to Get Faster End Results from Your R Models

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Bioconductor</linkText><linkUri>http://bioconductor.org/</linkUri></externalLink>: Large repository of R packages in bioinformatics
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Bioconductor</linkText><linkUri>http://bioconductor.org/</linkUri></externalLink>: Large repository of R packages in bioinformatics

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Quick Start Guide for R</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524954</linkUri></externalLink>: Provides a detailed walkthrough of a time series forecasting example and tips about working with R in Azure Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Quick Start Guide for R</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524954</linkUri></externalLink>: Provides a detailed walkthrough of a time series forecasting example and tips about working with R in Azure Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: Extending Experiments Using the R Language
trans-unit.target: Extending Experiments Using the R Language

trans-unit.source: There are many ways that you can extend your experiment by using custom R script or by adding R packages, including:
trans-unit.target: There are many ways that you can extend your experiment by using custom R script or by adding R packages, including:

trans-unit.source: Adding packages to perform custom math operations.
trans-unit.target: Adding packages to perform custom math operations.

trans-unit.source: For example, there are R packages to solve differential equations, generate random numbers, or run Monte Carlo simulations.
trans-unit.target: For example, there are R packages to solve differential equations, generate random numbers, or run Monte Carlo simulations.

trans-unit.source: Defining custom transformations for data, or adding packages to read new data.
trans-unit.target: Defining custom transformations for data, or adding packages to read new data.

trans-unit.source: For example, there are R packages to flatten hierarchical data into a flat data table, import data from Excel or export it to HTML, or perform interpolation on time series data.
trans-unit.target: For example, there are R packages to flatten hierarchical data into a flat data table, import data from Excel or export it to HTML, or perform interpolation on time series data.

trans-unit.source: Specifying optional arguments for the underlying R functions.
trans-unit.target: Specifying optional arguments for the underlying R functions.

trans-unit.source: Creating custom metrics for evaluation.
trans-unit.target: Creating custom metrics for evaluation.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use an R package to evaluate models with functions used by other statistical packages.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use an R package to evaluate models with functions used by other statistical packages.

trans-unit.source: Splitting Columns by using R
trans-unit.target: Splitting Columns by using R

trans-unit.source: Sometimes the data requires extensive manipulation to extract features.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes the data requires extensive manipulation to extract features.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might get a text file that contains an ID followed by values and notes, all separated by spaces or by characters that are unsupported by Studio.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might get a text file that contains an ID followed by values and notes, all separated by spaces or by characters that are unsupported by Studio.

trans-unit.source: There are several R packages that provide specialized functions for this task.
trans-unit.target: There are several R packages that provide specialized functions for this task.

trans-unit.source: For example, the <externalLink><linkText>splitstackshape library</linkText><linkUri>http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/splitstackshape/index.html</linkUri></externalLink> package contains several useful functions for splitting multiple columns, even if each column has a different delimiter.
trans-unit.target: For example, the <externalLink><linkText>splitstackshape library</linkText><linkUri>http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/splitstackshape/index.html</linkUri></externalLink> package contains several useful functions for splitting multiple columns, even if each column has a different delimiter.

trans-unit.source: The following sample illustrates how to install the needed packages and split apart columns.
trans-unit.target: The following sample illustrates how to install the needed packages and split apart columns.
